qas.question: Who developed the first commercial steam powered device?
What was the first steam powered device used commercially?
In what year was the first commercial steam powered device invented?
Who notably improved the Savery water pump?
Who wrote of the Savery water pump in 1751's Philosophical Transactions?
Who developed the first commercial engine powered device?
What was the first textile device used commercially?
In what year was the first commercial textile device invented?
Who notably improved the Smeaton water pump?
Who wrote of the Smeaton water pump in 1751's Philosophical Transactions?

context: The first commercial steam-powered device was a <a1_0><a1_1><a1_3>water pump<a1_3/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, developed in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><b6_0><b7_0>1698<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> by <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b5_0>Thomas Savery<b5_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_0/>.<a0_1/> It used condensing steam to create a <a1_2>vacuum<a1_2/> which was used to raise water from below, then it used steam pressure to raise it higher. Small engines were effective though larger models were problematic. They proved only to have a limited lift height and were prone to boiler explosions. It received some use in mines, pumping stations and for supplying water wheels used to power textile machinery. An attractive feature of the Savery engine was its low cost. <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>Bento de Moura Portugal<b8_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> introduced an ingenious improvement of Savery's construction "to render it capable of working itself", as described by <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><b9_0>John Smeaton<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> in the Philosophical Transactions published in 1751. It continued to be manufactured until the late 18th century. One engine was still known to be operating in 1820.
